required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Concordance of Pelvic Organ Mobility Measurements Between the Finite Element Model and the Dynamic Pelvic Floor MRI in Patients Undergoing a Sacrospinofixation Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Concordance of Pelvic Organ Mobility Measurements Between the Finite Element Model and the Dynamic Pelvic Floor MRI in Patients Undergoing a Sacrospinous Ligament Fixation Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to demonstrate the feasibility of using a Finite Element model of pelvic organs by evaluating the concordance of pelvic organ mobility measurements performed by this mechanical model compared to the observations on the post-operative pelvic MRI in patients undergoing a sacrospinofixation surgery

primary_outcome.measure: Concordance of mobility measurements of points C, Ba and Bp between the FE model and the dynamic MRI after SSF
primary_outcome.description: Concordance of mobility measurements of the 3 points C, Ba, Bp during the defecation sequence, between the Finite Elements (FE) model and the dynamic pelvic floor MRI after sacrospinous ligament fixation (SSF)

secondary_outcome.measure: Concordance of mobility measurements of points Aa and Ap between the FE model and the dynamic MRI after SSF
secondary_outcome.description: Concordance of mobility measurements of points Aa and Ap during the defecation sequence, between the Finite Elements (FE) model and the dynamic pelvic floor MRI after sacrospinous ligament fixation SSF)

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the pelvic organ mobility before and after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of the mobility of the different points of the POP-Q classification (C, Ba, Bp, Aa, Ap) before and after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Elasticity study of the vaginal tissue (Lille)
secondary_outcome.description: Elasticity study of the vaginal tissue removed during surgery (for patients operated in Lille only)

secondary_outcome.measure: Concordance of mobility measurements between FE model enhanced by the vaginal tissue analysis and the dynamic MRI after SSF
secondary_outcome.description: Concordance of mobility measurements of the POP-Q points (C, Ba, Bp, Aa, Ba) during the defecation sequence, between the Finite Elements (FE) model enhanced by the analysis of the vaginal tissue sampling and the dynamic pelvic floor MRI after sacrospinous ligament fixation (SSF)

arm_group.description: After accepting the surgeon's proposal to perform a sacrospinofixation to treat the pelvic organ prolapse, participation in this study will be proposed to the patient. It will not change the management or the course of the surgery

intervention.description: 6 months after surgery, a Dynamic Pelvic Floor MRI is performed

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women aged 18 to 80
- With at least a grade II apical prolapse according to the POP-Q classification
- Treated with a sacrospinous ligament fixation (SSF) by the vaginal route
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of abdominal, pelvic, vaginal or vulvar surgery except hysterectomy
- Association of another POP or urinary incontinence surgery (subvesical plication, levator myorrhaphy, plication of anterior rectal wall, perineorrhaphy ...)
- MRI contraindication
- Legal incapacity or limited legal capacity
- Subject unlikely to cooperate with the study
